text:
*[Bug 18649] Cairo device enforces minimum radius for points*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18649>

Paul Murrell (<mailto:paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz|paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
     Ever confirmed|0                           |1
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CONFIRMED
                 CC|                            |paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz

--- Comment #1 from Paul Murrell (<mailto:paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz|paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz>) ---
I can confirm the problem and the diagnosis appears to be correct.

Some useful next steps would be to: 

* determine whether there is a good reason why the Cairo device sets a lower
limit on radius (and, for example, the PDF device does not)
* determine whether any other devices set a lower limit on radius (including
third-party devices)
* think about (and test) whether changing the Cairo device to allow smaller
radii would break anything important in existing behaviour.
